[Speech Language Pathologist (SLP)](https://www.google.com/search?q=speech+language+pathologist+jobs)
• Assess, diagnose, and treat communication and swallowing disorders in individuals of all ages.
• Job satisfaction is high due to the ability to improve the quality of life for individuals and their families.
• The average salary for an SLP is $80,000 per year in the United States.
• The average salary for an SLP in the Tri-State Area (New York, New Jersey, Connecticut) is $90,000 per year.

[Speech Therapist](https://www.google.com/search?q=speech+therapist+jobs)
• Work with patients to improve communication skills through speech and language therapy.
• Job satisfaction is high due to the opportunity to help patients overcome communication difficulties and achieve their goals.
• The average salary for a Speech Therapist is $66,000 per year in the United States.
• The average salary for a Speech Therapist in the Tri-State Area is $72,000 per year.

[Pediatric Speech Language Pathologist](https://www.google.com/search?q=pediatric+speech+language+pathologist+jobs)
• Assess and treat communication and swallowing disorders in children.
• Job satisfaction is high due to the opportunity to positively impact a child's development and improve their quality of life.
• The average salary for a Pediatric SLP is $66,000 per year in the United States.
• The average salary for a Pediatric SLP in the Tri-State Area is $74,000 per year.

[Speech Pathologist Assistant](https://www.google.com/search?q=speech+pathologist+assistant+jobs)
• Assist licensed Speech Language Pathologists with assessment and treatment of communication and swallowing disorders.
• Job satisfaction is high due to the opportunity to make a difference in the lives of patients and work closely with licensed professionals.
• The average salary for a Speech Pathologist Assistant is $40,000 per year in the United States.
• The average salary for a Speech Pathologist Assistant in the Tri-State Area is $44,000 per year.

[Medical Speech Language Pathologist](https://www.google.com/search?q=medical+speech+language+pathologist+jobs)
• Work in hospitals, clinics, and other medical settings to diagnose and treat communication and swallowing disorders in patients with medical conditions.
• Job satisfaction is high due to the opportunity to work with a diverse range of patients and help them recover from illness or injury.
• The average salary for a Medical SLP is $85,000 per year in the United States.
• The average salary for a Medical SLP in the Tri-State Area is $93,000 per year.
